intro: Cheiranthus tataricus, commonly known as the Tatarian honesty, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in racemes, blooming in late spring to early summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
